one_liner: This technique uses machine learning to analyze hysteresis behavior in perovskite solar cells.
how_it_works: The technique involves collecting current-voltage (JV) curve data from perovskite solar cells during voltage sweeps. Machine learning algorithms are then applied to this data to model the relationship between the direction of the voltage sweep and the resulting current density. By analyzing the model outputs, researchers can identify patterns of hysteresis and assess the stability of the solar cells under different conditions.

steps: 1. Collect JV curve data from perovskite solar cells under various voltage sweeps.
2. Preprocess the data to normalize and clean it.
3. Apply machine learning algorithms to model the relationship between voltage sweep direction and resulting current density.
4. Analyze the model outputs to identify hysteresis patterns.
5. Validate the model using additional datasets.
6. Use insights to improve PSC design and measurement protocols.
algorithm.input_format: JV curve data from perovskite solar cells, including voltage and current density measurements.
algorithm.output_format: Insights into hysteresis behavior and stability metrics of PSCs.

parameters.name: sweep_speed
parameters.effect: Affects the resolution of hysteresis analysis.
